name: Oneohtrix Point Never
description:
'''Daniel Lopatin''' (born July 25, 1982), best known as '''Oneohtrix Point Never''' or '''OPN''', is an American [[electronic music]] producer, composer, singer, and songwriter. He began his career the early 2000s as part of Brooklyn's [[noise music]] scene and later received early acclaim for the [[synthesizer]]-based compilation ''[[Rifts (Oneohtrix Point Never album)|Rifts]]'' (2009) as well as the influential [[vaporwave]] side-project ''[[Chuck Person's Eccojams Vol. 1]]'' (2010). His work since has experimented with [[wikt:trope|trope]]s from an eclectic range of musical genres and eras, and has featured [[Sampling (music)|sample]]-based composition and complex [[MIDI]] production.

Lopatin signed with [[Warp Records]] in 2013, and has since released studio albums on the label to critical praise. He has also contributed production work to various artists, most extensively [[the Weeknd]], [[Moses Sumney]], and [[Soccer Mommy]]. He has composed [[film score]]s, most prominently in collaboration with the [[Safdie brothers]] on the films ''[[Good Time (film)|Good Time]]'' (2017), ''[[Uncut Gems]]'' (2019), and ''[[Marty Supreme]]'' (2025); the former won him the [[Cannes Soundtrack Award|Soundtrack Award]] at the [[2017 Cannes Film Festival#Cannes Soundtrack Award|2017 Cannes Film Festival]].
